channel.title: Posts on Development Cheat Sheets
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Development Cheat Sheets

item.title: Building images with Kaniko in Jenkins
item.description: An overview of how I set up Jenkins to be able to build (docker) images with kaniko inside my Kubernetes cluster.

item.title: Migrating from Jekyll to Hugo
item.description: This post contains information about the migration of my Github development-cheat-sheets page (this site) from Jekyll.

item.title: Photo Finder Script(s)
item.description: This post contains information about creating various Windows powershell scripts to assist with managing our photos.

item.title: My First Hugo Post
item.description: Welcome Hello world, this is my first Hugo blog post. I hope you like it!

item.title: Dell Inspiron 7537 - Preventing Linux shutdown when closing the lid
item.description: This is a little post about how to prevent a Dell Inspiron laptop from shutting down or going into standby when you close the lid on the laptop.

item.title: Hack for SQLite use on Kubernetes
item.description: This page captures a technique I developed to work around the issues you can encounter when using Persistent Volumes (PVs) that contain SQLite databases used by containers in Kubernetes.

item.title: K3s on Raspberry Pi
item.description: A project to set up a small scale multi worker Kubernetes instance at home (sometimes called a ‘home lab’).

item.title: K3s with customised Traefik Ingress
item.description: This post contains some details on how to customise the k3s (default) traefik ingress controller.

item.title: Migrating Gogs from SQLite to MariaDB
item.description: This page documents my efforts to migrate my Gogs database from SQLite to MariaDB.

item.title: Oracle XE 11g to 19c Upgrade
item.description: This post captures the steps that I went through to upgrade my Oracle XE 11g database, which I use for some of my development projects, to Oracle XE version 19c.

item.title: Running Stable Diffusion on low resource PC (Dell Inspiron 7537)
item.description: This page documents my efforts to get Stable Diffusion running on my old Dell Inspiron 7537 laptop.
